metadata.name: Ladies’ Lair Lake - Red Handed (video), 2022
metadata.description:
“Ladies’ Lair Lake - Red Handed” (video), 2022 (TRT: 2:20 Min) is an excerpt from a feature length video entitled “Ladies’ Lair Lake” by multimedia artist Trulee Hall.

“Ladies’ Lair Lake” is a musical based on an original libretto and score written by Hall which narrates a creation myth. The mythological narrative takes place in an edenic forest setting, beside a lake inhabited by a sorority of nymphs overseen by a benevolent yet mischievous goddess. The sisterhood, chameleon-like and at one with their surroundings, coexists in harmony with nature, adopting the characteristics and appearance of water, land, and flora.

The video incorporates a variety of techniques and mediums, including CGI, claymation puppetry, green screen, found nature footage, live action, painted dimensional sets and newly composed music alongside a choir.

Red Handed is chapter 10 of 14 that comprised the “Ladies’ Lair Lake” installation presented by Los Angeles Nomadic Division (LAND) in Los Angeles, CA February 16 - March 27, 2022 where viewers were invited to walk through Hall’s universe by engaging with its characters through labyrinthine rooms of sculpture, video, and painting.

Red Handed features three green female marionette characters Hall calls “Window Watcher 1 and 2” and a third character called “Mom.” The Window Watchers sing a song narrating a conflict.

Originally the Red Handed video chapter was shown in the context of a site specific installation that featured puppets and a painted backdrop.

Complete documentation for “Ladies’ Lake Lair - Red Handed” can be found in the following K-Spec: https://kspec.io/assets/0xd7301c30E1A20189b2bDf3630f199a0033C7c760/1

creation_process: Three different cameras were used to shoot the raw footage including a Black Magic Pocket Cinema 6K, a Canon 5D Mark III, and a Canon Mark 6D
The work was made in Final Cut Pro, Maya, and Dragon Frame

installation_instructions: The artwork is comprised of 8 components including 1 Reclaimed, Handpainted Hollywood movie backdrop measuring 78” x 45,” 3 Marionette Puppets measuring 21” x 50” x 6” with each doll measuring 21” x 5” x 6,” 2 Marionette Hands each hand measuring 17”, 11” x 2,” 1 video file
The artwork is to be installed indoors.
String for marionettes provided to install the objects from the ceiling.
Video is to be viewed on a Flat Screen.
The artwork is presented with center of the screen around 57”.
If shown as a projection, the video should be at least 1080dpi.
Ideally, the work is to be presented in a dimly lit space with black walls.
The sound is to be exported to stereo.
